sections.description:
WA Timetable is a lightweight and user-friendly WordPress plugin designed to display stylish timetables on your website. Whether you're a sports fan or a professional event organizer, this plugin provides a simple way to showcase schedules and events in a clear, accessible format.

Features
  • Fully Responsive: Timetables look great on any device, from desktop computers to mobile phones.
  • Customizable: Easily change the look and feel of your timetable to match your website's theme via the plugin settings.
  • Shortcode Integration: Simply use a shortcode to embed the timetable on any page or post.

sections.changelog:
2.6.4

  • Implemented a new 'TODAY' label for the current day's tab in the timetable navigation.
  • Updated the plugin version to 2.6.4 in the main plugin file and all associated documentation.
  • Organized and added a header to the main stylesheet for better readability.
  • Fixed a bug where a session was incorrectly showing as unfinished when all nested units had published results. The plugin now correctly checks the status of all units to determine the overall phase status.

2.6.3

  • Added support for handling grouped qualification events. Groups with the same start time are now correctly displayed in the timetable. Swapped Morning Session and Evening Session names and corrected Day count.

2.6.0

  • Refactored and reorganized the core CSS file for better readability and maintainability.
  • Added a new, professional CSS header to the stylesheet.
  • Removed an unused .session-header class.

2.5.0

  • Updated the plugin's core functionality to use a more efficient data fetching method, resolving previous performance issues.

2.4.0

  • Fixed a bug that caused the timetable to display incorrect times due to timezone conversion errors.
  • Improved the parsing logic for timetable data to handle various event formats more reliably.

2.3.0

  • Introduced new styling for a clearer visual separation between timetable sessions.

2.2.0

  • Corrected an issue where certain events were not displayed on mobile devices.

2.1.0

  • Refined the responsive design to ensure the timetable adapts seamlessly to all screen sizes.

2.0.5

  • Refactored the core plugin file to introduce a new constant for the assets folder, improving file path management.
  • Updated all enqueue URLs to use the new asset constant, making the code more robust and maintainable.

2.0.4

  • Relocated CSS and JS folders to the assets directory, and adjusted the enqueue URLs accordingly.

2.0.3

  • Resolved

error by fixing an object-to-array conversion issue.
  • Added support for banners by updating readme.txt format and PHP parsing logic.
  • Corrected text formatting and list display issues in the

link.
  • Updated GitHub username from smoothdeisgns to smoothdesigns.
